While I do agree with you, I feel that if they implemented it in a way that was small-scaled (ie only a few items are limited in this fashion), then it could be used as a very powerful balance tool.  Think of it sort of like how melee and ranged only passive/actives used to exist on multiple items and then take it a step further and limit certain items to specific classes.

Also, it generally isn't tanks (I am referring to tanks only, not tanky classes like juggernauts and bruisers) abusing damage items so odds are they might be able to build any item they want (whether said item is a good buy is of course up for debate).

True 100% tank items also aren't usually abused by classes, it is generally the damage/tankyness hybrid items (such as steraks) that lead to problems.  If steraks could only be bought on bruisers, tanks, juggernauts, and divers a lot of the issues with the item would have been significantly reduced, and champions like gnar, who is a bruiser, would still be able to build it.
That's the price of diversity.
